projects.name: ShapeShiftOS
projects.caption: Founder of Open-Source Android-Based Mobile Operating System
projects.description: Created an open-source Android-based mobile operating system for Qualcomm devices in 2020 and have maintained it since. Shipped custom kernel scheduler, under-screen fingerprint scanner animations and icons, system theming engine based on color-palettes, Google Lens integration in screenshot tool, dynamic TrueType lockscreen clock, and upstreamed code to Google Material Components.

projects.name: ResumeIDE (LaTeX Desktop Editor)
projects.caption: Open-Source Full-Stack LaTeX Resume Editor (Tauri, React, TypeScript, Rust)
projects.description: Built a desktop LaTeX resume editor with live PDF preview using React 19 and Tauri 2. Implemented async Rust backend for real-time LaTeX compilation, Monaco Editor integration with syntax highlighting, system requirement detection with guidance, and cross-platform desktop deployment with native performance.

projects.name: Bibliotheque (Library Management System)
projects.caption: Open-Source Full-Stack Library Management System (Next.js, PostgreSQL, TypeScript, Supabase)
projects.description: Built a real-time library management platform achieving <50ms search latency. Implemented secure auth with row-level access control, admin dashboard, and concurrent CRUD operations.

projects.name: Traffic Flow Simulation and Stochastic Modeling
projects.caption: Traffic Flow Simulation and Stochastic Modeling
projects.description: Built a lightweight simulation (Python, NumPy, Matplotlib) to model non-linear traffic congestion across a 6.2-mile road segment using sinusoidal flow dynamics. Generated synthetic datasets with Gaussian and uniform distributions and visualized congestion patterns under different parameters.

educationData.school: Henry Samueli School of Engineering and Applied Science

achievements: Upsilon Pi Epsilon Computer Science Honors Society
Stein Engineering Scholar, Shirley and Walter Wang Computer Science Scholar

courses.name: Freshman Computer Science Seminar
courses.description: Introduction to department resources and principal topics and key ideas in computer science and computer engineering.

courses.name: Calculus of Several Variables
courses.description: Introduction to differential calculus of several variables, vector field theory.

courses.name: Introduction to Computer Science I
courses.description: Introduction to computer science via theory, applications, and programming. Basic data types, operators and control structures.

courses.name: Introduction to Study of Language
courses.description: Summary for general undergraduates of what is known about human language; biological basis of language, scientific study of language and human communication.

courses.name: Introduction to Engineering Design: Machine Learning
courses.description: Introduction to machine learning using Python. Covers Python programming, machine learning fundamentals, and LaTeX. Students develop and train neural network image classifiers using PyTorch.

courses.name: Introduction to Computer Science II
courses.description: Object-oriented software development. Abstract data type definition and use. Overloading, inheritance, polymorphism.

courses.name: Physics for Scientists and Engineers: Mechanics
courses.description: Motion, Newton laws, work, energy, linear and angular momentum, rotation, equilibrium, gravitation.

courses.name: Software Construction
courses.description: Fundamentals of tools and environments for software construction projects, particularly open-source development.

courses.name: Introduction to Computer Organization
courses.description: Introductory course on computer architecture, assembly language, and operating systems fundamentals.

courses.name: Introduction to Educational Issues and Scholarship
courses.description: Introduction to broad landscape of public education in U.S. Intended for those interested in educational research, policy, or teaching in both formal and informal settings.

courses.name: Introduction to Engineering Design: Rockets
courses.description: Introduction to rocket engineering, covering launch vehicle structure, trajectory, stability, and propulsion. Topics include computer-aided design, structural analysis, manufacturing, aerodynamics, and flight dynamics. Students design, build, test, and launch solid-propellant rockets.

courses.name: Linear Algebra and Applications
courses.description: Introduction to linear algebra: systems of linear equations, matrix algebra.

courses.name: Logic Design of Digital Systems
courses.description: Introduction to digital systems. Specification and implementation of combinational and sequential logic.

courses.name: Calculus of Several Variables
courses.description: Introduction to integral calculus of several variables, line and surface integrals.

courses.name: Physics for Scientists and Engineers: Oscillations, Waves, Electric and Magnetic Fields
courses.description: Fluid mechanics, oscillation, mechanical waves, and sound. Electric charge, field and potential, capacitors, and dielectrics. Currents and resistance, direct-current circuits.

courses.name: Introduction to Discrete Structures
courses.description: Discrete structures commonly used in computer science.

description: New Verticals Team, early engineer on Harvey Word Add-In
Built Workflows for Word, a block-based agentic system allowing in-document actions in Microsoft Word, including the "Draft from Template" and "Translate" workflows
Implemented editing features such as bulk apply/undo of suggestions and justification comments for applied changes
Delivered product refinements including dark mode, guidance screen, and broad UI/UX enhancements to improve full-document edits and the Assistant for Word experience
Open-source award-winning Android-based mobile operating system with a highly customizable user interface and unique features

Developed features including in-screen fingerprint animations and icons, Google Lens screenshot tool integration, variable font-weight lock screen clock, custom kernel scheduler, upstream contributions to Google Material Components, etc.
Grew to 160,000+ downloads across 160+ countries organically with no marketing budget
Recruited talented engineering team consisting of 25+ Qualcomm device engineers and 3 core developers
Received SourceForge Open Source Excellence Award (top 0.5% of open-source projects)
UCLA Experimental Space Physics Group, working on thermal vacuum chamber (TVAC) software
Implemented a real-time TVAC data dashboard in React with performance-optimized sensor visualization and a configurable, thread-safe PID control system via FastAPI
Tech Team for the largest collegiate hackathon in Southern California
Contributed to system architecture for new application portal, including DB schema/index design, and introduced strict, scalable TypeScript standards
Built responsive React frontend components including multi-filter search, event schedule timeline, and gallery carousels
Engineered plagiarism-detection tool that statistically analyzes Git commit patterns, time distributions, and code changes
Founding Team at seed-stage LLM-powered social media platform out of Berkeley I&E / ACE@Berkeley
Developed dynamic virtual worlds and character classes for AI-driven social interactions, with features like jetlag, coordinate-based world travel system, weather, global news, and friendship levels
Implemented high-performance RAG pipeline with Pinecone vector search to enhance conversations, frontend UI components with React/TypeScript, and character and world features with Python
Integrated AWS Rekognition for content moderation and set up analytics tools (Sentry and PostHog) for user tracking and error management
